name: Espresso
steps: Tamp coffee into portafilter.
Lock portafilter into espresso machine.
Start shot and extract for 25-30 seconds.

name: Latte
steps: Pull a shot of espresso into a cup.
Steam milk until velvety and microfoamed.
Pour steamed milk over espresso, holding back foam.
Top with a small layer of foam.

name: Flat White
steps: Pull a shot of espresso into a cup.
Steam milk to a silky microfoam.
Pour steamed milk over espresso, with very little foam.

name: Caramel Macchiato
steps: Add vanilla syrup to cup.
Pour steamed milk into cup.
Add espresso shot on top.
Drizzle caramel sauce over the top.

name: Matcha Latte
ingredients: Maple syrup, honey, stevia, or sweetener of choice (optional)
steps: Sift your matcha powder to ensure it is lump-free.
Spoon the matcha into a large mug.
Add the hot water and whisk briskly in an up-and-down motion until frothy (about 30 seconds).
Add the warmed coconut milk and whisk until well combined.
Taste and adjust by adding additional water, coconut milk, and/or sweetener to your liking.

name: Strawberry Acai Coffee or Green Tea Drink
ingredients: 2 tablespoons green tea or coffee, chilled
1/2 pound fresh strawberries, stems removed and halved
2 tablespoons simple syrup (or sugar or honey, adjustable)
steps: Make green tea or coffee and let it chill in the fridge. (You can prepare this ahead of time.)
Prepare the strawberries by removing green leaves and cutting them into halves.
Add strawberries and 1 cup of water into a blender. Blend until smooth and then strain through a fine mesh.
Whisk together acai powder and 1/2 cup of water until dissolved. It takes a few minutes for the powder to dissolve completely.
(Optional) If you don't like the tiny black particles from the acai powder, strain the mixture through cheesecloth or a coffee filter for a clearer look.
Add the acai mixture, white grape juice, and chilled green tea or coffee to the strawberry juice. Mix to combine.
In a large pitcher with ice cubes, add the strawberry mixture and the rest of the water.
Add simple syrup to your desired sweetness. You can also use sugar or honey. Start with a small amount, taste, and gradually add more. Mix well.
Fill each glass 1/3 full of ice cubes and a scoop of strawberry slices. Pour the drink into the glass and serve immediately.
